title: Fx Separators & syncing
content:
One of the big advantages with Fx compared to other web browsers is the bookmark feature: separators.

This feature helps to organise bookmarks and make menus easier to navigate, especially for power users like me who build big bookmark libraries.

One problem though, there seems to be no support for syncing separators! Am I correct or is something wrong in my setup?

The bookmarks sync fine but separators are lost between computers.

If there is no support for syncing separators is there a plan to fix this? Meanwhile, is there a workaround?

P.S. A great way of using separators is to make titles in menus by using capital letters with separators around them.

Example: ________ [Separator] BOOKS [Folder] ________ [Separator]

"1984" by George Orwell [Bookmark] "Fiesta" by Ernest Hemingway [Bookmark]

title: Cursor jumps to address bar from the Google search text box when typing search queries in the Google search bar on the new page splash page.
content:
I've already looked at another question about the same issue. Half the fixes don't exist on my version of Firefox. There is no check box that I can locate, <shift>+F12 doesn't bring up any settings page as was suggested possibly do to developer tools that had been added while taking a collage class on web scripting. F12 brings up the developer tools and overrides the <shift> function. The page that does allows me to change settings simply doesn't have the option to use the search bar in the splash page instead of the address bar. No, this is not a feature I installed and I can not remove and reinstall it short of deleting and reinstalling Firefox. Which might not even fix it so I'm a little unwilling to do all that work to achieve nothing and possibly lose functionality in the process.

Do I consider this a high priority? Na, it's just really annoying. I mean, what's the point of even having that search feture if I can't use it?

The closest work around I could think of was to set a search page as my home page. And yes, I will be using a non Google search page just out of spite. So there. :P

)

I have installed the most recent versions of Firefox on all my devices (version 89.0 on desktop, version 88.1.4 on Android). I have disconnected all devices in Firefox Sync Account and reconnected all of them. Still the problem persists.

title: FF89 (Proton UI) - Web Search on New Tab Only Runs From Address Bar
content:
Since upgrading to FF89 (the new Proton UI) I've noticed a change in behavior when I try to perform a web search from a New Tab. When I try to type a search string in the Google search bar on a New Tab, any character I type immediately appears in the address bar (see attached image) and search suggestions are shown in a drop down under the address bar.

With FF88 (the old Photon UI) I could type my entire search string into the Google search bar and then hit "Enter" to start the search.

Is this a bug in the way that searches are performed from a New Tab in the Proton UI or a deliberate design change? Is there some setting I can change to stop the Proton UI from running my searches from the address bar when I search from a New Tab?

An image of my New Windows and Tabs settings is also attached, and my default search engine at Settings | Search | Search | Default Search Engine is set to Google. Note that I live in Canada and the custom URL for my Home Page is set to Google Canada (https://www.google.ca/), but any searches that runs from the address bar defaults to Google.com (e.g., https://www.google.com/search?client=firefox-b-d&q=<search string>).

Dell Inspiron 15 5584 * 64-bit Win 10 Pro v20H2 build 19042.985 * Firefox v89.0.0 * MS Edge v91.0.864.37 * Microsoft Defender v4.18.2104.14 * Malwarebytes Premium v4.4.0.117-1.0.1308

title: white screen + scrolling reset after a long non-use of the tab
content:
Good day! My name is Denis, and the problem that I will describe to you is not critical, but very annoying every day.

In recent versions of the browser, after a long period of non-use of tabs, the page scrolling is reset on these tabs, and the content is arbitrarily darkened with a white background. Sometimes for half a page, and sometimes for the entire visible part of the screen. This white background disappears with the slightest scrolling down.

The changes that I made to the config file have nothing to do with, although there are a lot of them. I completely removed the "deep scan" tails cleaning moss in the "Revo Uninstaller Pro" program. + search and fix registry errors in "CCleaner". The data that I sent to the DE, that the DE picked up when I logged the call, shows Firefox v88 as above, however as far as I am aware it is V89 as of the 1/6/21, which happens to be when the problem showed itself. This could be a coincidence as I logged the problem in the moring and Firefox tells me it ws updated at 16;50 that day. I am assuming that it is GMT.

Firefox 89.0 (20210527174632)Details Installed on: 1 June 2021, 16:50:58Status: The Update was successfully installed Firefox 88.0.1 (20210504152106)Details Installed on: 6 May 2021, 10:39:01Status: The Update was successfully installed

I immediately went to sessionstore-backups folder and found that Firefox wiped it, created new empty recovery.jsonlz4 and recovery.baklz4 files and no other files are there (no, there are no alternative profiles in my Firefox directory).

I tried to recover deleted files using Disk Drill, however they seem to be corrupt, because the History Scrounger is not able to decode them. It was on my work laptop, so recovering the tabs would be extremely helpful and would save me lots of time and possibly some trouble too.

title: Can't Restore Previous Session
content:
I lost like hundreds of tabs (again) and I can't get them back (again). But before I concede to the issue I was wondering if there was another way?

First of all, my browser was was running slow/freezing, understandably so figuring I had too many tabs open. So I used Windows 10 Task Manager to stop it. I then restarted Firefox, but the option to restore the tabs after a crash didn't show up. I was left staring at a blank page. I've done this a million times and it usually works. But this was one of the times that it didn't.

I did the usual step. I replaced the current session file with the backup I thought I wanted. But that didn't work. I then did some digging around and stumbled upon this tool: Scrounger for Firefox. I tried using this tool the last time this happened, but every time I try to use it it crashes.

After some searching on Google I came to the conclusion that the file was too large to handle. I then tried running this script , but all it seemed to do was backup the restore session file and more than doubled it's size.

My questions are why won't the Scrounger tool work for me and is there another way I can get my tabs back?

Thank you for any help!

I mean themes are great for people that like that sort of thing but why not allow people to chose to change, rather than force a change and offer no option to just keep it the way it was? I mean it's a color palette not a security hole. Anyway, any help would be greatly appreciated.

Also, if this is the wrong place to ask this feel free to put it where it belongs.
creator: rusty.bailey

title: Toolbar icons not displaying correctly
content: After the latest Firefox update, some of the icons in my toolbar aren't displaying correctly. The Microsoft icons are correct, it's Mozilla Thunderbird, RealPlayer and my Power button that are incorrect. What's displayed is a white box, with a blue section in the middle, and text on the sides.

content: Firefox says add-on is downloaded (File Converter - By Online-Convert.com) which allows conversion of all types of formats. Before yesterdays automatic change over to 89, this add on would be visibile with right click drop down menu on any picture found browsing the internet. But now that add on, even though Firefox says its downloaded, does not appear on the right click drop down menu and no where to be found....Appreciate a tech savy response. KEN B

title: Problems with new update
content:
April 21, 2021 Mozilla updated my Firefox to 88 and I had no problems with that update. Today I have lost hours trying to get my tabs changed so I my eyes are not strained by the glare and and appearance of the frequently used site tiles. Glare sets off my migraines. One volunteer "luckett67" suggested a temporary fix to someone else that helps so I hope it continues to work. Why am I having these issues:

1. Tabs I want open above the address bar sometimes disappear.

2. DuckDuckGo jumps from the inquiry rectangle to the https:// line on the top, which is not what I am used to.
creator: candy3066

title: Windows Default Theme
content: Why can I no longer use the Firefox default theme? I can select it, and it is listed as "Enabled" but the plain grey screen keeps showing not the default. I went to Add-ons & Themes and disable automatic updates but I still got the prompt informing me to restart Firefox to update. Is it just me or is Firefox really getting worse with each update?

title: tabs missing with new update
content:
My firefox installed a new update, 89, and now my tabs are missing, except that the active tab is floating down at the center bottom of the screen. i can still navigate with keyboard shortcuts, but i don't know how many i have open, what they are, and personally DO NOT like navigating with shortcuts if i don't have to.

why is it necessary to keep messing with tabs? weren't they just fine below the address bar back in the day? How is ruining the user experience worth whatever was even trying to be done here?

image is how my firefox looks right now
creator: luckytrefoil

title: FF 89 tabs are moved to the top, want them on the bottom below shortcut bar
content:
FF89 has moved tabs to the top of the window, above the address bar. I'd like them back where they were, below the shortcut bar.

I appreciate help, but also, please provide clear instructions for someone that is NOT a FF dev, don't just say "update your css". I'm unable to find userchrome.css it doesn't appear to exist in this version.

If possible, a simple, non Dev approach would be appreciated, such as Settings > Tabs > tick box "Tabs under shortcut bar".

For anyone working on FF development, this is the sort of thing that a lot of users would like to customize, so this setting should be in Settings and it should not be changed from what users had already set.

Thanks for your help.
creator: wharminda
